articles.author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Former inmate bitten by police dog files $500,000 lawsuit against Columbia County
articles.description: It alleges the Columbia County sheriff's deputies committed unlawful assault and battery and the use of a dog against a jailed inmate in a locked cell amounted to “cruel and unusual punishment.’’

articles.author: Eder Campuzano | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Southern Oregon county terminates $45,000 jail contract with ICE
articles.description: Josephine County Sheriff Dave Daniel said it was a "risk versus reward" move, citing lawsuits against two other Oregon counties over federal detainees.

articles.author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: DA's office to review case of inmate bit by police dog while in jail cell
articles.description: Columbia County Sheriff Jeff Dickerson said he and other agency officials have previously determined the use of force was justified. But reaction to recently released body camera footage of a 3-year-old Belgian Malinois being sicced onto 47-year-old Christoph…

articles.author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: No criminal charges in case of inmate bitten by police dog while in jail, DA says
articles.description: A review of the evidence in the case showed K9 handler Deputy Ryan Dews and other deputies used a reasonable amount of force against Christopher Bartlett on August 1, Columbia County District Attorney Jeff Auxier said in a February memo to Sheriff Jeff Dicker…

articles.author: Jim Ryan | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Clark County man accused of kidnapping woman, sexually assault her: records
articles.description: Douglas L. Braaten, 61, is suspected of offering a ride to a woman in Portland, taking her to the Columbia River Gorge and sexually assaulting her, court records show.

articles.author: Gordon R. Friedman | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Columbia CEO to pay $1.5 million for new downtown Portland homeless shelter
articles.description: Colombia Sportswear chief executive Tim Boyle plans to pay $1.5 million to jumpstart construction of a 100-bed homeless shelter and services center on city-owned land under the Broadway Bridge, officials will announce today.

articles.author: Anna Marum | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Husband accused of burning wife with hot oil, smothering infant son
articles.description: The woman says that as Crothers attacked her, he accused her of playing the victim.

articles.author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Multnomah County jails review report notes issues with staffing, inmate resources
articles.description: A grand jury report released Wednesday also noted the inmate population at the county's two main adult jails is disproportionately black, and cited the need for additional services for newly released prisoners as well as alternatives to incarceration for thos…

articles.author: Guest Columnist
articles.title: After all this time, why fire sale Wapato?: Guest opinion
articles.description: If I gave my financial investor money and they made a decision to sell my investment for a loss of about 80 percent, it would be nothing short of criminal.

articles.author: Molly Harbarger | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: One more chance for a Wapato Jail homeless shelter? Maybe, says new co-owner
articles.description: Jordan Schnitzer said Tuesday that he wants to give Homer Williams' nonprofit the first crack at leasing at least part of the 155,400-square-foot facility to run a homeless shelter. The offer is good to anyone in the community who has a viable idea for fundin…

articles.author: Aimee Green | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Man who dumped junky RVs on Portland streets gets 25 days in jail
articles.description: John Phillip Maher, 55, apparently became overwhelmed by his initial goal of stripping the RVs of recyclables and disposing of them properly. Instead, he left them along North Portland streets, investigators said.

articles.author: Anna Marum | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: High-speed chase ends with police shooting at truck with infant inside
articles.description: The driver was ultimately arrested and charged with two counts of attempting to elude police, four counts of reckless endangerment, as well as reckless driving.

articles.author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Son sentenced in N. Portland car-theft, crushing scheme; Dad next
articles.description: After his sentencing, sheriff deputies took Tony Schneider Jr., 26, into custody Thursday to start serving two months in jail with five years' probation. He and his father have agreed to pay $500,000 in restitution and have produced about $300,000 of the sum …

articles.author: Noelle Crombie | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Man attempts getaway, speeds off Astoria pier in pickup truck (video)
articles.description: "He just took off straight toward the pier," said J.D. Moreland, 50, of Astoria. He said he pulled out his phone and shot video as the man sped up. "He just started driving on that pier as fast as he could."

articles.author: Fedor Zarkhin | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Mortified mom of teen charged in Eagle Creek fire speaks: 'This is a trauma for him'
articles.description: The boy's family fears a public backlash and that his school-age siblings might face retaliation.
